first of all i am a girl but i dont like this movie because of leonardo dicaprio i think he was quite okay but anyone else could have played his role  and better thats the only thing that bothers me about kate winslet was great as poor little rich girl rose and also billy zane as unimaginable bastard cal the huge ship is just fantastic its luxury amazingi just loved romantic scenes like im flying with that breathtaking sunset but what fascinated me most were the 63 minutes of the sinking sinking faster and faster panic rising and rising more and more people trying to escape from death but drowning of being sucked back into the ship and more and more things getting destroyed  these aspects made the sinking the movies most breathtaking suspenseful and moving minutes thats the best about the movie to mefor me kate winslet is a great actress not only for her good acting but also for her patience and perseverance to hold out i suppose it must have been hard to do the sinking scenes as i read that kate once almost drownedive seen six times yet and every time the sinking was as suspenseful and moving to me like seeing it for the first time i can almost feel the cold water and the sheer terror those people feel and that makes me want to cry each time also the romantic my heart will go on when i saw for the first time i cried when the ship broke apart now only the beautiful song makes me cryalthough three hours make almost too long its a great movie which i like to watch again and again i dont like leonardo but i love that movievote 10

epic adventure film the story of the tragedy might have been told in a better way  a night to remember  but it has never been and never will be told in a bigger way a huge amount of money was spent and unlike some other films  waterworld  it showed leonardo and kathy bates are excellent while the others give pretty good performances the climax is probably the best in hollywood history and the sets are also fantastic having said that  the movie is certainly not the best of all times and i doubt that it deserved the 11 oscars kate certainly didnt deserve to be nominated the movie swept away the whole world and probably the academy members also got a little carried away it definitely is worth watching at least twice

this movie got a hold on me from start to finish its very rare for a movie to do that to me from the opening scene with the beautiful music i was hooked everything looks so beautiful the set decoration the costumes the boat itself everything the cinematography is brilliant pure eye candy camerons oscar for best directing is so well deserved how he manages to show people falling and walking across the entire boat is amazing theres this shot where the camera moves from the very head of the boat to the very back and literally everywhere something is happening brilliant piece of directingthe acting was good as well especially kate winslet en billy zane the latter plays very convincing a real bastard very unpleasant person but perfectly actedthen the music the soundtrack is one of the most wonderful ever made the central theme of the woman humming is beautiful just like many other songs like for instance nearer my god to thee very moving together with the accompaning sceneof course people whove never experienced the sinking of a ship themselves cant really image how that feels but with this movie i had a feeling that we were able to experience from minute to minute what they must have went through i thought the panic of the disaster was very realistically shownthe special effects the sinking of the ship was the highlight of the movie seeing how the ship breaks falls down again and people falling down when the ship stands straight up is truly breathtaking without a doubt one of the most impressive special effects i ever witnessedadd that to what i said about the music the set decoration the cinematography the directing the realistic showing of the disaster and you get one of the best movies ever made i put in my top 10 favourite movies of all time

this is probably one of the finest epic movies of our time it will surely have its place as a classic for years to come for the monumental budget and phenomenal cast it lives up to its hype james cameron did a superfluous recreation of the tragic illfated voyage the personal drama and romance only further pull us in and connect us with the past we feel the pleasure the pain the loss with the characters vicariously though the vivid sets dynamic characters and heartwrenching plotleonardo di caprio and kate winslet were truly cheated at the awards but their performance in will be wellremembered for years to comeit is truly a masterpiece in its own time but what more can really be said about it than has already be said

ill admit it was hard to have no expectations for 11 oscars and of course the hype would lead you to believe that this is the greatest movie of all time while the movie was very good it is far from the greatest of all time the visual effects are outstanding but the dialouge and several errors detract from the overall story the movie ignores the ship californian which was less than 20 miles away the love story  while touching could have been lifted striaght out of alladin more than worth your time for the effects alone but suffers somewhat due james camerons script and editing choices

the craze was out everyone was talking about it girls swamped the theaters to see it 78910 times best movie ever they said to i finally rented it i have to say that i found it sadly lacking it was a historically inaccurate movie about a girl that cheats on her fiancee i find it sickening that the american people find such great pleasure in a movie like this there was no action at all in the first 2 or so hours of the film leonardo stood around and looked cute and kate stood around and tried to look cuter the evil character in this movie was completely one dimensional showing us no other qualities of himself except that of some ogre which makes you wonder why kates character ever got engaged to him anyway when her romance with leonardo began she never before during or after suggested to the ogre that they should just be friends she decided just to skip that and start steaming up some windows and why did people see it so many times did they expect the ending to change after the eleventh viewing were they hoping to see the boat not sink i think it could have been a wonderful movie if they had based it more on fact such as gettysburg or braveheart the true story of the is filled with action and sorrow and loss enough that they didnt need to ruin it with a revolting play of a cheater an ogre and a pretty boy that brought excitment to an otherwise boring and uneventful voyage

i went in to the film with low expectations i thought the acting wouldnt be brilliant nor would the script but the special effects would make up for it  much like godzillabut i thought yes  ill put 4 hours of my life into this effort 4 hours that i will never get back no matter what i domy summary 1 lame script and dialogue 2 weak acting from all and sundry except perhaps billy zane and definitely his bodyguard  who rocked in twin peaks 3 romantic moments cliched and signalled from on far by the use of the theme 4 for the first 3 hours of the film pretty weak special effects the ship and the sky were both clearly computer generated for most of the filmthe sky looked incredibly fake it was more starstudded than mars attackssecondly when people cant act or rather dont act both leads gave superb performances in other movies eg dicaprio in gilbert grape and winslet in heavenly creatures one would expect them to be pleasurable eyecandy here dicaprio really keeps up his end of the bargain hes too good looking grrr but kate winslet seems peculiarly miscast her english accent breaks through and she is not particularly attractive subjective sexism aside though i cannot understand how the academy felt her performance was of nominee standardonce the ship starts sinking the special effects do improve some but very little else does the ridiculously cliched script continues unfazed making the characters implausible anyone as evil as zanes character would wear an eyepatch and leonardo dicaprio would have been shot by someonea film i feel completely outclassed by all of its conominees for best picture la confidential and as good as it gets both shine out as excellent movies time and time again the academy needs to get a gripalso what was the gloria stuart nomination about

is the most overrated movie of all time  i know that it sweeped the oscars for the year 1997 but that doesnt mean that it deserves to be recognized as it is now  there are numerous reasons why the film was labled as the best picture  first of all it made 1 billion dollars worldwide and thats the record for any films  the reason  leonardo dicaprios in the movie and if you are a girl and doesnt like leonardo dicaprio you are not normal  i know several girls who saw about 20 times  also the movie was in fact entertaining i must admit  i enjoyed it  the sound and the score by james horner and the cinematography was excellent  also the year was a weak year for films  l a confidential or good will hunting or as good as it gets were good but not terrific but they were better than  was a blockbuster but the screenplay sucked  the screenplay sucked like hell  the plot was simple a poor livingonthewildside boy meets a rich girl who is controlled by her mother and falls in love  it is the most simplest plot ever  even a fiveyearold can think of that  but the excellent direction of james cameron actually overcame the screenplay and made it entertaining so james cameron deserved an oscar for best director  but the fact of the matter is even with all the technical excellence the foundation and the backbone of all films except for action films the screenplay sucked  remember the line rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose rose   is that the best cameron can think of  films such as l a confidential and good will hunting or as good as it gets had better screenplays and better cast of actors then  so in conclusion i admit that was a good action  chick flick but it did not deserved to be awarded as the best picture of 1997

well what can i say is just the best movie ever it has it all the acting is great kate winslet was stunning and beautiful she deserved the oscar for her role as rose i cant wait to see her next movie hideous kinky leonardo also did a great job the movie is fantastic if you didnt see it in the cinema go and see it on video now

when i first saw this movie the day it opened i was going in because i liked the cast i like james camerons work i was blown away by trailer and i prefer not to judge a movie by its budget  i am not a fanatic about the actual ship my reaction has always been its a big ship it sank  so what  back on opening day though some rave reviews had already come out some dissenting views had also come and while interest was expected no one knew the ultimate fate of the movie  and at the theater i saw it in the projector broke down three times in the first five minutes and i think its safe to say the audience i saw it with was ready to kill  then finally the movie went on interruptedby the end though we of course took the free passes the theater provided us to apologize for our inconvenience we were transfixed by what we had seen on screen  james cameron is a director who tries here to make art out of pure entertainment and he suceeds on a massive scale  there were better movies in 1997was 8 on my top ten list that year the first seven were in order the sweet hereafter la confidential as good as it gets the ice storm ulees gold in the company of men and grosse pointe blank but this was the best pure entertainment of the year  the physical achievement of the movie of course is not to be forgotten particularly when the ship sinks and the scene where jack leonardo dicaprio and rosekate winslet are standing in the front of the boat the im flying scene which when i saw it in the trailer was what made me want to see the movie  but the love story worked for me as well as did the wraparound story of the old rose gloria stuart remembering when she was in the heart of the ocean  dicaprio is a good actor and hes good here though a bit too modern for me but its winslet who gives the movie its heart playing passion to the hiltbut as the 70s were the me decade and the 80s were the greed decade the 90s can probably best be described as the backlash decade  as soon as a work or artist in popular culture american anyway becomes popular it seems people have a felt need to line up and dump on it simply because a lot of other people like it and they cant stand it  this is not to say all popular culture is good  rather it is to argue that just because a lot of people like something doesnt automatically make it bad  this is not the movie of the year the decade or the century but its a great movie and i wish people would get over themselves and not consider those of us who feel like i do cretins  this will stand the test of time

is a good film and ill give it that but to call it the best film of all time is ludicrous i love romantic films but i think the love story in this film was uninspired i mean did anybody else notice how in one scene jack and rose disliked each other and the very next scene they were talking about riding horses together in the sunset gimme a break there were a couple amusing and touching moments and i did enjoy the filmbut to even put it in the same ranks as gone with the wind is utterly hilarious

the movie was as everyone knows a huge success and a beautiful love story but as i watched the grammys the other night i realized exactly what james cameron gave to those involved with his project from the heart  look at what the film did to leonardo dicaprios career  i know you werent paying any attention to him when he was on that kirk cameron show  kate winslets name no longer goes unrecognized  gloria stewarts age old days in hollywood were revived and probably the most wellknown soundtrack in the history of film was created  now james horner has a grammy to add to his collection of golden globes and oscars for the beautiful music he created that moved us to tears  granted celine dion wasnt doin too terrible before her heart went on but now shes polishing and putting up the multiple awards shes won for singing the i know overplayed theme song we will never get out of our heads  as for others in the film bill paxton and his earring will always be remembered  it replaced those visions of flying cows we had in our heads  and instead of a question mark we view billy zane as the mean guy who tried to shoot leo  cameron braved cold waters to get that movie made and im sure glad he did  it amazes me that here in february 1999 over a year since the movie was released theyre still giving it awards  cameron may have said the wrong words on oscar night but he did a bang up job on what has been called one of the greatest movies of all time  he not only gained access to do what ever movie he wants in the future but he gained a girlfriend too

first of all i want to express how impressed i am at how intelligent so many of the comments here have been it kind of surprised me because i figured the average person who loved or hated the movie would be at least a little bit on the dull side we are talking about people who in my opinion got so carried away with the romance that they completely overrated the film or people who i thought were going to blast the film for stupid and superficial reasons i was wrong the comments here have been fantasticthis was a good movie but it is not one of my favorites of all time it is a very beautiful film at first and obviously becomes ugly when we slowly watch the brutal disaster get worse and worse we know that the ship sinks we know that many people died and we know that it was a long time ago but cameron succeeds in bringing new and intense emotions out of us anywaywhile has hard work precision and passion it does lack some real intelligent writing much of this movie is like a high quality soap opera filled with chatter and nonverbal language that left me bored several timesstill i thought the romance special effects music and acting were all good enough for me to enjoy the and will probably watch it several timesi have seen several people here change their minds about when their original opinion was way on one side or the other of the spectrum that is because when you use your openmindedness you will probably find that this is not a nearperfect film nor is it a piece of crap but that the is a pretty damn good movie plain and simple

it is widely known that the director is the hardest working person on the set  james cameron takes this fact to a new levelcameron took a great interest in the great ship back in 1989 while filming his deepsea thriller the abyss  in 1994 cameron began principal photography of the wreckage just off the coast of newfoundland  as cameron took his cameras deep into the atlantic tears came to his eyes as he looked at the destroyed vessel for the first time  cameron was on a mission to recreate the story of the great ship a mission which could be called the greatest accomplishment in film historyincorporates the widest variety of genres it is a romance a drama an actionadventure a suspensethriller  it is a tearjerker a spiritlifter a special effects extravaganza  it drew in an audience demographic so wide that children grandparents and all in between love to watch it over and over  it is one of those few films that you can see ten times and still love it still notice something else which makes you love it more  took moviemaking to a new level both technically and thematically and in such a way that its achievement may never be surpassedcameron poured his heart into this film  he wanted to produce a tale of the ship which would have a great effect on its viewers make them feel for the passengers the tragedy of the ship the power of rose and jacks love  the symbolism of their relationship mirrors that of the ship itself  their love for each other although shortlived will last for an eternity  they came from a different world different backgrounds yet the essence of their inner selves is so wholesome so connected that they could not stand to be apart even if it meant changing everything they knowthe film reaches into our hearts shows us a love so pure so tragic and destined for destruction yet we all truly care for rose and jack wanting them to survive so their hearts can go on  tears came to my eyes on five different occasions while watching this film  i was pulled into the story the characters and the sheer presence of the ship  i wanted everyone i cared about to experience this film to be able to feel what i felt to see what i saw  cameron showed me a side to the human spirit human tragedy and the power of love well beyond anything i knew possible  i am eternally thankful for camerons monumental achievement and i will never forget experiencing

this was james camerons best work yet ive said before that was the best movie ive ever seen but when i saw it definitely was the best i even own a copy of i doubt the new staw wars movie will even come close

im a big james cameron fan and am really happy this brilliant director finally got his due while diehard cameron fans might be surprised that the movie isnt the nonstop thrillasecond yarn they are used to they will really appreciate his involving characters flawless eye for detail and spectacular special fxthe movie isnt perfect though while jack and rose are warmly human fleshed out characters most of the others are reduced to dissapointing cardboard charcters too badmaybe they will be explored in the directors cut while gloria stuart is very touching as old rose she was robbed at the oscars by kim basingergrrrrwhile the movie is more than 3 hours long it never feels like it you experince total awe as james cameron whisks you back in time allowing you to explore the worlds most famous liner in perfect detail after the 3rd class dance scene you actually hope in your heart the doomed liner never hits that icebergafter the ship hits  we are exposed to the sinking of the in equal almost scary detailand here cameron is in his best formi found the realism of the ship breaking in two almost disturbingly real a great unforgettable motion picture that should not be missed truly deserving of its best picture oscar

where can i start i love 30 minutes of this movie the sinking of the ship will go down as one of the great effects sequences in cinema history yet i couldnt help feeling cheated at spending my cash on cinema entry for this movie the love tale is far too poorly written to maintain interest of the more actionorientated viewer of which the film is partly complex and also too simple to interest someone who loves good character interaction i believe that the best character in the movie cal billy zanes character didnt get nearly enough screen time i laughed heartily at his youd almost pass for a gentleman line directed towards jack and the black and white original footage was very emotional but little things like this a fraction of its 3 hour duration dont assist an over rated and drawn out film i may be going against popular opinion but i saw at least 8 better movies than this in 1998 and will see another 8 this year im not totally against the movie but i cant stand a film winning on hype a good but not great movie 610 man im harsh

most of the criticism ive read of james camerons on this site and elsewhere has been unjustified and trivial  i can easily imagine people going to a theater  having already decided they hate the film  and watching it for the first time looking for anything to criticize so they can justify their prejudicesthat said some of the criticism was right on target  the worst part of the movie had to be the contemporary scenes with bill paxton  other than providing a framework for telling the story i got the impression that one of the main reasons these characters were included in the movie was to give the audience the celluloid version of an applause or weep sign  the submarine crew particularly the antihappyface character and paxton were unbelievably callous at the beginning but by the time rose finished the story they had become mistyeyed at the old womans harrowing tale  the transformation appears quite artificialim a little surprised that no one has commented on the peculiar relationship between the contemporary and historical scenes  after all it wasnt until elderly rose said essentially those of us who were on the remember it differently  at that point we faded back to 1912 and rose began narrating the story  but within a few moments her narration fades outwe are led to believe that what we see on the screen is the visual equivalent of what rose speaks to her contemporary listeners  but within a few minutes we start seeing scenes which rose could not have witnessed much less described jacks card game discussions between the ships manufacturers and the captain and so forth  was rose simply making these things up or did cameron quietly replace rose as the narrator  i realize some may think it a trivial point but imagine if cameron had filmed the rest of the movie from roses perspectivewe would have missed out on a lot of panoramic views  the propellers turning the flyover view of the ship the pistons churning  as well as other scenes such as when lovejoy put the diamond in jacks pocket the conversations between minor characters in which rose was not present the reluctance of the captain to speed up and his ultimate despair after the ship started to sinkon the other hand we would have gotten a much fuller picture of roses passion for jack who would probably be a somewhat more mysterious figure since we wouldnt know if he had pocketed the diamond or not reportedly dicaprio had asked cameron to portray jack with something of a dark side  to make him complex in some way  but the director had refused  in addition to being a more intimate film if we saw the complete story through roses eyes everything would be much more chaotic since we wouldnt benefit by knowing all that the captain and crew know  while camerons gives us a birds eye view of the disaster and one might add the personalities of the characters roses would convey the sheer terror and panic in a way that probably more closely resembles the experience of the unlucky 1500its easy to see how this would be a much different movie  much more complex and terrorizing  this reminds me of the landingatthebeach scene in saving private ryan where the camera gives us a view of what the soldiers actually saw  the chaos and the horrible realism  seeing the event entirely through the eyes of rose would likely offer the artistic direction which so many find lacking in camerons filmbut would it actually be a better moviei have my doubts  camerons succeeds because it actually balances quite well between the cerebral justthefacts rendition of the ships sinking that many of us saw in a night to remember and what could have been a gutwrenching though confusing inyourface chronicle of roses painful experience  instead we have a very good blend of historical account and personal tragedyin addition to offering an appealing story for some moviegoers the fictional romance between rose and jack serves at least four other important purposes  first by allowing the camera to follow them around we get to see more of the ship  both first class and third  second unless the movie were to run nine hours it would have been impossible to show in detail what happened to all of the real people on the ship  but by following rose and jack we can gain a glimpse regrettably brief of some of the main real characters  third as pointed out by others particularly those fond of 1st officer murdoch we dont really know the true story in many cases and to connect the dots in regards to real characters risks disparaging their memory  by focusing on rose and jack we gain a fairly realistic view of the times the people involved and the event  finally the loss of roses lover makes the tragedy more personal to viewers in a way that a night to remember couldntwhen you think of the other ways this story might have been told  instead of just citing the movies shortcomings  you may gain an appreciation for camerons  it may not be one of the best movies ever made but its definitely worth a 200 rental and three hours of your time

big budget version of the famous story has become the most successful film of all time and jointly the biggest accademy award winner 11 in total leonardo di caprio and kate winslet are excellent in their roles  it is long but beautifully filmed and will probably leave most of the audience quite red eyed  this movie is a classic

now i dont cry at movies and ill be the first one to say if a movie really stinks but was a perfect movie  there were a few problems likewell if theyre standing in water chesthigh and things are electrically shorting out then why are they still alive  and when she hit that guy while she was looking for the key to the cuffs before he even touched his face he had blood all over his hand  and when everyone was outside starting to get into the lifeboats why couldnt you see anyones breath  it was just as cold then as it was when they were all in the water but despite these things got all that it deserved  it was everything people want to see in a movie  personally i think that at times the whole love story was a little drawn out but its not the love story that makes the movie this director james cameron reportedly said he wanted a hollywood veteran to play the role of old rose whose character is aged 102 and a stillliving survivor of the at the time of an undersea search  and a veteran he found in gloria stuart hollywood star of the 1930s and 1940s and 87 years of age when the film was shot  old rose slowly tells her story and spins her way into the hearts of millions on every continent where this film has played  eleven oscars this film took home among fourteen nominations garnered and most were deserved but the greatest among the three missing statues on oscar night was gloria stuarts  without her this film was an fx extravaganza with a serious lack of credibility  di caprio and winslet simply arent clark gable  vivian leigh and probably wont grow up to approach anywhere even close to the likes of them either  nevertheless cameron wanted a film that the world would remember and he got one  that ship was as real as anything yet created out of thin air  loudest applause for him and the massive crew that made this film possible and for gloria stuart who made the story credible  top rating 5 stars of 5

i read a night to remember when i was in high schooland remember seeing the 1953 film on television it looks hokie today  but it seemed gripping when i first saw it so i looked forward eagerly to seeing james camerons movieespecially when early reviews suggested it was pretty good i expected to see a meticulous depiction of the ship itself as well as a harrowing reenactment of the sinking what i did not expect was to be as moved by the human story several people have asked why cameron felt he had to include a fictional love story in a story about a reallife tragedy first the jackrose love story gave the moviegoer a chance to see most of this great ship while exploring the different worlds of firstclass and steerage secondly and most important of all cameron felt that if he made you care about the fate of two fictional peopleit would make the fate of the 1500 real people who died on the seem more tangible and concretei can understand if a lot of people resent leonardo dicaprio in my opinion he got too much of the credit that should have gone to kate winslet but i dont understand why people think this movie is badly written some of the lines do have a contemporary ring to them but the characters are vividly drawn and the screenplay is much better than is given credit a beautiful example of good writing by cameron occurs in the scene where rose almost jumps off the stern of the ship jack tells rose what it feels like to fall through thin ice and get immersed in freezing water not only does this serve the practical purpose of getting rose to want to come back aboard the ship it prepares the audience for what victims will feel when the ship sinks other versions of this tragedy watch the ship from a distance and makes the audience feel they are safe in the lifeboats in contrast james cameron makes the audience identify with the unlucky ones left on the ship and dying in the water and as in seven samurai because the audience recognizes and comes to know several of the passengers and crew their deaths have all the greater impact when the ship finally sinks

the direction of james cameron is great and the human stories are powerful but the romance of jack and rose is too played and unoriginal  the acting by the two leads is also uninspired  but the movie is still good and far better than most disaster movies

i saw james camerons oscar winning epic and i saw a mesmerizing piece of art unfold before my eyes  i couldnt believe how this movie just came together  the visual effects were outstanding the costumes were brilliant the cinematography was wonderful and yes believe it or not excellent actingin my opinion kate winslet made this movie and deserved her oscar nomination for wonderful performance as rose  kate winslet is truly one of the actresses for the future she has already had two oscar nominations and she is only 23  she was brilliant but it wasnt her absolute best her best is jude see it for all you kate watchers she is wonderful in this movie  if it wasnt for kate winslet this story probably wouldnt have worked leonardo dicaprio was wonderful and he shouldve had more award praise for his performance but it wasnt his best also whats eating gilbert grape and he was nominated for that  now gloria stuart was good but i thought kathy bates shouldve gotten in instead because her character stayed realall those people who sat such bad things about are crazy because whats not to love  i know everybody is tired of the song my heart will go on is a wonderful song and it fits the movie perfectly  this is a gem of a movie and when rose looke up and saw jack up there while she was going down with everybody was so pivotal because she them jumped onto the deck and saw that her life whole would be everything she is with jack not with an arranged marriage with a controlling jerk played brilliantly by billy zane remember when molly brown kathy bates asked him at the dinner table are gonna cut her meat for herthis was such a materpiece and the only drawback was why did the older rose just throw the gem into the sea it was puzzling but that still doesnt mean that this movie  gets a 10

sorry but i just dont see what all the fuss is about here  handsomely designed and appointed movie terrific special effects and costumes etc but the leads are so bland and lackluster that i wasnt able to care whether they drowned or not winslet has exactly one facial expression decaprio is much too 90s to be convincing as a 1912 roustabout and neither of them made me believe they were passionately in love which makes most of their actions in the last hour look simply brainless if not suicidal  most interesting relationship in the film is actually between rose and the ships designer

it ends with two young lovers riding the sinking ship as if it were a drowning bucking bronco yet the unembarrassed hyperbole of director james cameron doesnt injure  the film is all artifice but in the best way  cameron vigilantly captures the horrifying details of modern historys most infamous disaster and consistently shapes his scenes with the ideas of dread class and blind arrogance in mind  despite the rather clunky script and histrionic acting the film becomes some kind of alarmist masterpiece about an event of painful cultural humblingthis is largescale blazon as art which begs the question  can the idea of historical tragedy get across in a spectacle an inherently exhibitionist and factitious form of cinema  surface pageantry will capsize thematic ambitions without granting a final gasp  here though camerons gluttonous temperament binds itself to an extravagant action rhythm with a sharper sense of suffering and for the first time he seems to understand his characters as much as he does the machines and carnagetheres nothing enigmatic about the relationship between jack dawson leonardo dicaprio a thirdclass vagabond and rose dewitt bukater kate winslet a highsociety debutante ensnared by her snobfianc but the ripe vibrancy shared between jack and rose points toward a future that will never come for most of the passengers  the film isnt exactly tastefulcameron is all too willing to kowtow to the morbid fascination of catastrophebut it feels classy and the extraordinary special effects take on a certain elegancein fact i would argue without reservation that is the greatest visualeffects movie ever made  miraculously cameron uses those effectsand his own eye for thrilling aestheticsto magnify the youthful romance at the storys center into a contemporary romantic tragedy  the films final third in which the passengers gradually begin to realize their peril while the boat slowly sinks ranks as wideeyed spectacle that cleverly mines adolescent infatuation as a springboard for authentic terror and nightmare shock  as jack and rose cling to a wreckage rapidly being sucked under the icy waves the moment isnt quite heroic  instead their frantic stab at survival makes your stomach sink tooeric beltmann

for me was a particularly moving film as it had amultilayered theme to its credit on the one hand of course there was the tragedy of a great ship along with the massive loss of life involved which james cammeron managed effortlessly to be able to portray in all its sadness however it was for me more the somewhat subtle and ingenious use of the theme of young adventurous life coming into fruition then almost ruthlessly extinguished by events beyond anyones control jack and rose young lives seemed to be paralleled with that of the young life of the ship itself the fact that jack was so well portrayed by leonardo di caprio as basically a lovable little scoundrel fortunate enough to find the enigmaticyoung rose was a wonderful counterpoint to the film rose herself was shown in many touching clips through kate winslets acting to be just as vunerable in her young feelings and emotions as jack himself another thing that i feel this film achieved which makes it such a rare masterpiece is that it brought home to me a 33 year man the intangible link between youth and old age the old rose still pined for her young love many years after the tragedy of the sinking but had right from the start bravely resolved to carry on to live a full life her heart must have ached so much isnt that so like many people of today  ie carrying the burden of some loss though trying to live for tomorrow this theme i felt brought out the fact that older people do have experiences and emotive feelings well worth valuing another theme that i felt was wellaired was the vunerability of man to his own ego ie it was the captains desire to finish his career with a flourish that helped cause the tragedy to happen   the need for speed in a sense hope that my comments are echoed by others who watched this great film thanks for the timejim  289

when i first saw this movie a year ago i was looking foward to an ok movienothing special but you knowwhat the hell  the theaters were packed fullall 3 showing the movie that is  when the music and the footage of the ship leaving dock first started my heart already ached because i knew the ship was the culmination of the worlds optimism  i also knew that it would sink killing 1500 people  what a lesson in human arrogance and stupidity  though the sinking of the ship was indeed sad it is the characters that make the story absolutely heartrending  the story of rose and jack two starcrossed lovers andrews guiltridden that he hasnt built a stronger ship unsinkable molly brown a mother who is saddened by what her daughter is forced to do but ultimately goes along with it the craven bruce ismay villains caledon hockely and valethenchman spicer lovejoythe list continues the technical prowess of cameron cannot be overlooked  the special effects were astounding especially when the ship starts sinking and you get the full impact of the size of the ship and the horror the passengers must have felt when they realized that the unsinkable ship was turning into a steel tomb  the music was perfect  i cant say any more  if you havent seen it youll know what i mean when you see it  and if you have seen it you already know what im talking about  and at the endwhoo boy  i didnt have nearly enough kleenex  i think my sister was the only dryeyed one there  there were times when i couldnt hear over the viewers snuffling  i saw it again last january and cried just as much well i finally got the movie a week ago and i promised myself i wouldnt cry  denied  i cried more than the first timei suppose i already knew what i was in for  if you havent seen it at this late date then by all meanssee it you dont know what youre missing  though it did have some rather corny dialogue the inertia of my roses life oh please i give it 6 of 5 stars

as a buff since the age of 5 i was very excited and impatient to see this filmthe whole of 1997 i was on pins and needles awaiting its release you cant imagine how crushing it was when it delayed from june to december  of course with that much anticipation i was worried that i might also be massively disappointedbut not only was i happy with the results i was ecstatic  this movie is simply extraordinary  it magnificently beautifully brings the back to life fulfilling ones dream of actually being able to sail on the mammoth linerbut what really drew me back again and again to see it was the radiant exquisite performance of kate winslet  she propels this movie with such grace and beauty that its difficult to take your eyes off her despite all the chaos going on around her  if the oscars were given out based on genuine excellence of a performance the statuette wouldve been hers unfortunately politics has to play a part so she was denied what was justly hers  but shell get it someday i know it

i realize that is really the kind of movie where you love it or hate it for what it is and i must say that in all truth i side strongly with the love it categorywhen i first saw this masterpiece nearly a year ago i was in short amazed at the power director james cameron had achieved by setting up the actual disaster with a love story he was able to make me feel like i was right there on the decks of the as she sank below the atlantic surface seeing 1500 people freezing to death in the chilling ocean waters in the dark early morning of april the 15th 1912 i was simply shocked chilled mostly because of the realization that this is what happened also having known that cameron had labored so long and hard to get even the most nonessential details correct in his depiction of the ocean liners disaster helped me feel it toothere is definitely a lesson to be learned from quite a few really for one thing it is the ultimate reminder that no matter how technologically advanced we are god will always have the last word on everything perhaps the disaster was a reminder that we need to be careful what ideas we get about our power she is unsinkable god himself could not sink this ship said the character calanother lesson this one related to film if you are going to spend hundreds of millions on the making and marketing of a film at least make an honest effort to give the audience a story they can feel and be involved with recent films such as armageddon and godzilla i think have been hurt by this overwhelming realization by audiences the gross of which has hit 18 billion worldwide testifies a new hunger for movies that tell their story with really great effects in them rather than stories written around the idea of effectsi know there are many dissenters out there for this film but like it or not twenty years from now there will be a big rerelease for this wonderful epic and again the world will be caught in a craze and i will be telling my children about when first came out  just as my dad tells me now about when star wars came out he was floored as well like ninety percent of the rest of the moviegoing nation works so well because it hits so many basic levels of human feeling because it has such a strong understanding of what the devotion of love isand for those of you who call off and its success to leomania i went to see ten times in the theater i am not a big leofan and i know hes done better work than this i am 19 and im a guy going to see this in the theater not once in those ten times did the audience consist of at least 75 percent adultsa masterpiece nuff said

im an american guy which i guess means that i wasnt even supposed to go see  it much less think it was goodany foreigners dont worry about itsi it was the other way around i spent 675 and went into the theater expecting a mildly good movie and i got 10 times more than that and then some to say that this was a stupid movie is well almost blasphemous by adding the love story it added life to whereby saving it from a disaster movie like so many other movies the sinking at the end was more than just a sinking it was the end of 1500 peoples lives bravo to james cameron for making such a great film although without a score there isnt enough emotion and james horner created one of the most masterful of all timethis truly is one of the greatest films of all time

in no doubt from 1997 is the best film ive ever seen and will probably remain so for a long while james cameron has always been one of my favourite directors and this time hes made his finest work so far hopefully theres more to come of these top class cameron films one day in the end of april 1998 i went into the cinema to see and i had waited for months to see it i thought it would be a really great film i had great expectations because almost everyone who had seen it said i was so good and it was a thousand times better than i thought its an amazing story about the rich firstclass girl rose dewitt bukater kate winslet who falls in love with the thirdclass passenger jack dawson leonardo dicaprio who won his ticket with a lucky hand of poker and together they experience the kind of love we all want to have but seldom find ive never actually appreciated love stories on film but this film changed my opinion about what really makes a good movie its not just cool action scenes but also romantic love stories and has both of them the best parts of two totally different worlds of filmmaking combining the best special effects ever and a great love story this movie has everything great script direction acting music james horner is the best music composer of all time and a lot of other things the movie is so perfect theres almost nothing ive noticed which is wrong of course there are things that dont match the real happenings such as the flashlights from the lifeboat which never were there in reality but its not a documentary it is a film and everything does not have to be absolutely correct to make it a good film james cameron is the best

tragedy as action movie entertainment bill paxtons lines at the end about not getting it could not have been more ironic there wasnt a genuine emotion in the entire film winslets performance was heroic but not even the wizard of oz could have breathed life into these straw figures not since around the world in eighty days has such a bad movie been so acclaimed

this movie could have become a real disaster a love story between a rich girl and a poor boy  seen it a thousand times and it always had a happy end not so in camerons film the hits the iceberg  it could have been like watching a 50s scifi today again camerons digital domain with hollywoods most famous specialeffectsfactories on their side created one of the most spectacular movies ever some movies get all these things right but still do a very messy job  eg use plates with a made in hong kong sign on them however cameron paid attention to the details all in all the actors were really good and not only leo and kate but billy zane and co as well and the breathtaking cinematography and music combined with camerons monumental style t2 true lies the abyss gave a wonderful mix

i saw in the first week it came out  i really enjoyed it  in school we were doing film music and i chose as an assignment  the role of music in the movie i am sure was the thing that added emotions and allowed to be one of the most emotive movies i have ever seen  i have given it a 10 and you will do well to do the samesend your comments to my email

when i entered the theater to see the film i expected to see a romantic epic reminiscent of doctor zhivago or even the english patient unfortunately all i saw was a 200 million film about social inequality a la romeo and juliet  the plot was so thin and the characters so underdeveloped that one longs for the ship to hurry up and sink within the first hour and a half  the boat itself was not even that amazing  although the sinking scene was semiexciting it got old seeing the two characters run through hallways only to be met by a door  about half an hour could have been trimmed from the film by removing these ridiculous scenes alone it still amazes me that this film received so much recognition not to mention the amount of money it took in at the box office  the only explanation i can offer is that apparently twelveyearold girls have nothing better to do with their time and money than ogle at the mediocre acting abilities of the girlish leonardo dicaprio  the true atrocity of this film is not merely how mediocre it is but the fact that it won the best picture oscar when such films as the sweet hereafter and la confidential truly deserved it  this is not to say that i hated this film but that it was not by any means the best film of 1997

i feel sorry about the families who lost their loved ones on that fateful night of april 15 1912 but this movie is a pure exploitation about the why some people think its a good film well at first this movie was good then i think this movie is overspent and waste of time because its a three hours and fourteen minutes of a ship sinking and about two lovers i did not cry in this movie because of the effects i got sick of it because of society exploit this movie too much like its a drug and i spent 650 for this garbage and the two studios spent 200 million for this crap its insane this about a rich girl who falls in love with a street punk its ridiculous and its not an extraordinary film you could recycle it to save the environment

i do not understand how so many people can dislike this film it is one of the most amazing cinematic achievements to come out in years i also do not understand how people who go to see films like this only see its faults socalled bad acting script etc and not the good qualities it possesses of which there are manyi admit that i am one of the millions who have seen this film and was swept away by the raw humanity of it it is not just a romanceit is also a retelling of a tragedy that affected the entire world  2228 lives that were changed on a single night there are a couple of minuses in this film but those are nothing in comparison to the many pluses  the sweeping love story the wonderful performances the beautiful costumes the grand ship the humanity of it allis not just a cinematic achievementit has class grace and elegance it is the film of the decadeand it will no doubt change the style of hollywood filmmaking in the future this is not just a filmit is the retelling of a tragedy entertwined with a love story an overall saga that will touch your heart and last in the memory for long after you leave the theatredeserves a 10chell

in some ways i can understand why some people hated this movie i agree that its overhyped and did not deserve either best picture or best actress the love story was cliched and lame dicaprios acting has seen better days check out basketball diaries and whats eating gilbert grape for a true picture of his talents though this wasnt really his fault but camerons rather badly written script and the script wellwhat can i say its really an action picture after all some important details leading to the sinking were glossed over or totally ignored such as the wireless operators role in the tragedy the californian ignoring pleas for help etc however the movie  is already quite long and in order to fit the love story in and develop the characters enough for us to care much needed to be left on the cuttingroom floor personally i dont have a problem with this documentaries and more historically realistic films about the have already been made this is meant to be a hollywood movie not a documentary or even good art cameron never leads us to believe that hes trying to make it anything more than it is and for what it is camerons is an excellent movie the only real problems i had was the underdevelopment of certain characters namely kathy bates as molly brown and victor garber as thomas andrews both these characters were far more interesting in their small roles than the two leads and its too bad cameron chose not to expand their roles even if it meant a fourhour movie i would have gladly sat the extra hour the other problem is the two leads as i already said dicaprio may have been miscast but his character was so inherently uninteresting and perfect that i doubt anyone could have done a better job he did look weird next to the voluptuous winslet however someone with a bit more meat on their bones perhaps who looked slightly older i dont know as for winslet well shes a good actress but oscar material hmmmm she seemed just a tad too um cheap and klutzy to pull off the role of a firstclass young woman with any believability a more refined and ethereal actress such as claire danes would have been a better choice also these characterss speech seemed too modern for 1912but i could be wrong here as for the sfx absolutely stunning and totally believable i really felt what it must feel like to be on a sinking ship the sequence with the band playing on as people either race about panicking or calmly succumb to their fate is extremely moving and made me cry more than anything winslet or dicaprio did this and the scene where the camera pulls back to show us thousands of people thrashing about in the freezing water chilling in more ways than one are perhaps the best in the movie horners soundtrack is moving and perfect though i could have done without the dumb and overplayed celine dion song during the closing credits best of 1997 maybe not but definitely up there with my favorites

when i saw this movie i thought it was great it was the movie of my dreams ive always wanted to see what looked like below deck while it sunk mr cameron and his crew has done a great job with the special effectssome of the actors were good but im not talking about leo or kate they did an ok job not bad but not great either captain smith and the officers were made for their roleswhat i dont understand is why they had to bring in leo and kate there were so many other true stories that happened onboard but i suppose hollywood must include the ultimate love story and a bit of sex in all their movieshistorically i found it very good i didnt find a single goof when i saw it but theres always some they were beyond my knowledge ofgood movie worth seeing could be an introduction to the fascination story of the ship that were unable to sink810 two points subtraction for bringing in leo and kate

im so glad to finally be able to get a sensible forum to utterly destroy this movie as it ought to be destroyed  what a horrible movie  i am utterly disgusted with the fact that this movie was even nominated for best picture  the rest of the films were outstandingly well made  the sunk and i am grateful first off this movie was way too long  and why were kate and leo even there  what purpose did they serve other than to try to humanize the movie by introducing a devastatingly unoriginal and lamely wrought love story the only purpose i could see was to lure people in and hit them with all the accustomed commercialist junk we always get nowadays  i saw the same if not a better love story in aladdin and whose idea was it to have perfect characters  leo is the perfect poor boy  billy zane is the evil suitor  kate winslet is the femme fatale none of the writers seemed to realize this and gave them what would have been classic movie parts without any grace or charm that the actors could manageably pull off i left the theater utterly disgusted and reflecting i should have seen la confidential or good will hunting again  those were films  was a waste of time and money and im glad i have convinced all that i could convince to not see it

first lets talk about the actors kate and the old woman were in nomination for an oscar i dont think kate is a bad actress shes ok but her acting in this movie is not at the level of an oscar maybe im wrong  for the fans  but the actors of the movie dont seem to feel theirs roles acting is at the level of a bseries moviefx the specials effect are more at the level of a 60 millions budget movies than a 200 millions movie class when the camera is away from the boat computered people looks more like a matches man than real people when i look at starwars new edition georges lucas have make a really good job i have to give one point to james cameron i like when some dude fall down and hurt the propeller of thehuman tragedies many have said that is one of the greatest disasters ever it is true but the way it is shown looks more like a joke than reality if you wanna see a movie of this kind see saving private ryan or even deep impact we are not talking about 2000 deads but millionsthe best point of is costumes they are really nice

yes its a beautiful love story but i feel more importantly was the vivid portrayal of the sheer terror over 2000 people experienced that dreadful night of april in 1912  the scenes of all those people running and screaming extending their lives by mere minutes by going to the highest part of the ship rather than giving in to their destiny really exemplifies the instinct of survival for as long as possible  it was a very educational movie for young people who did not learn of the tragedy yet and was also a marvelous film for people who knew about the already  you could really put yourself in their shoes and feel what it would have been like it makes you ask yourself many important questions including 1  why must we segregate people according to class etc 2  if you were a man could you have behaved like a gentleman and stayed behind 3  if you were a wife could you have left your husband on that ship and gotten into the life boat without him 4  if you were in a lifeboat and people were screaming for you to help could you have just rowed away to protect yourself 5  how would you have handled the loss of family members in such a horrible way this film will go down into history for its excellence and will continue to be viewed by millions of people forever

i expected to see a masterpiece given the hype related to this film  but all i got was 2 and half hours of cliche ridden dialogue and the most unconvincing romance between two leads since bill and hillary  admittedly the special effects were good as was the period recreation eg costuming set design  but overall the film failed on many levelsdid we have to get the class struggle entrenched in every frame of the film do we seriously believe that being rich is such a trial and so boring that one would prefer to go riverdancing with the third class to learn how to live did we have to see kate winslet naked what was the relevance except for the perve factor and why if you were aboard the when it was sinking would you keep getting off the lifeboat as ms winslet does with frequencyif i were billy zanes character why would i bother trying to shoot leo and kate when he was afterall on the  it was sinking for gods sakein short what could have been a good movie was hampered by appalling dialogue and atrocious plotting  it seems to me that 300 million dollars was spent on the sets costumes and special effects and the story was lifted from a number of 1930s and 1940s hollywood stories eg the rich girl meets boy from wrong side of the tracks or vice versa cant we get something a bit more sophisticated in 1998 instead of regurgitation of old plots

i have noticed many people blasting the academy for awarding 11 oscars to  however i have not really seen anyone offering other movies that were more deserving  this is mostly because was one of if not the best movies of 1997  remember that the oscars are given for individual years and not for all time  1997 did not provide many standout movies with the exceptions of good will hunting and la confidential personally my vote for best picture would have gone to good will hunting but i cannot blame people for thinking that was the best picture of 1997 because quite frankly what else was thereanother thing that bothers me is that many people say that the storyline is horrible dialogue is bad etc  did get nominated for best screenplay  no it didnt so it doesnt make sense to me that people would complain about that since the academy obviously recognized better stories than that of  the same holds true for dicaprio and i will admit that in my mind winslet and stuart probably shouldnt have received nominations eitherperception of the movie is vital to the viewers opinion  if a person goes into looking for a love story that person is sure to be disappointed because in my opinion the love story should be viewed as secondary or complimentary to the sinking ofall in all i feel that is definitely not one of the best ever but certainly it is one of the best of 1997

i was looking forward to this film for quite some time  although i was not a big fan of prettyboy dicaprio i always have like james camerons work and i enjoy kate winslet being british of course  i did however expect it to be just another story nothing being new  over here in britain the hype was not that big  i am a major film freak but i only heard about the film 2 months prior to its release  so i missed all the rumours of overbudgeting angry actors and flops so on its day of release i wandered to the cinema to check out this film that i had heard about  and oh my god i have always had a morbid fascination of the ship itself belonging to the historical society for over 5 years now  but nothing prepared me for the range of emotions i felt during this film  i left the cinema with misty eyes and heart so full of despairing hope that i needed some time alone before attempting conversation with anyone what an absolutely superb account of one of the most terrifying nights of the 20th century  for the first time ever i was transported back in time to feel the passengers confusion despair heartbreak and outrage  and seeing all through the eyes of our very own kate winslet  i was so relieved when she left the confines of her restricted life to embark on a journey of love with the young jack  i was laughing with them as they outwitted the awful lovejoy as they ran through the ship  i was smiling motherly as they explored one another and rose made the decision to leave the ship with jack but it all collapsed around them i felt their startled confusion as the iceberg hit  their decision to alert the horrible cal and roses narrowminded mother only to have jack accused of stealing and taken below  but rose wouldnt leave him and doing what i would have done she left cal to rescue her beloved jack  her bravery marked she was pushed into a lifeboat descending into the black water never looking away from jack as he waited on the doomed ship above  this is where i fell apart  i couldnt believe she was going to leave him  but she jumped back on board only to be chased back down into the bowels of the ship by cal you know i think it was essentially his fault that jack died  if he hadnt chased them jack and rose couldve made it to a lifeboat i have nothing but respect for the actors who brought these people to life for the first time in my life i felt as though my heart had been touched by the sight of such unbreakable love only to have my heart ripped out well done james cameron leonardo and kate  thank you for making me realise that life is what you make it  and thank you for teaching me that there are people who let nothing on earth come between them

im sorry  was i the only girl alive who really couldnt see what all the fuss was about soppy dippy wet and that was just l dic  and the plot had me cringing in my seatthe thing isim usually a sucker for romantic tragedies but something about this one really grated  it was too polished too ohlookatmewithour3milliondollarspecialeffects to actually care about the development of the characters or the plot  ldc  kw are never given a chance to emotivate their characters and really they became so annoying by the end that i was just wanting him to die and get it over withthe bits i did find moving were the sinking scenes  the doomed mother  kids the old couple and the band who just kept playing as the ship sank however the atrocious dont let go lovedeath scene ruined any sentimental feeling that i might have been persuaded to cultivate  i really advise you not to see this film unless you cant find anything better to do with the small hours of monday morning

it has now been five years since was released into theaters and broke box office records by taking in more than 500 million worldwide due largely to teenage girls the story soon became familiar to everyone poor boy leonardo dicaprio falls in love with rich girl kate winslet won eleven out of fourteen academy award nominations including best picture and best director james cameron this movie made leonardo dicaprio and kate winslet box office stars leonardo dicaprio became the biggest teen heartthrob since corey feldman while kate winslet became the hottest woman in hollywood this for me was most evident when these two kids in my sixth grade class made a wallpaper it was nonnude of her on the teachers computer however even with all the positive press this movie was getting some people felt that was not all that it had been hyped up to be those people felt that was really nothing special the acting especially that of leonardo dicaprio totally sucked and some people claimed that the best part of this whole movie was when kate winslet stripped naked before having her youth immortalized as one of the girls in jacks book even after hearing all of these negative comments about this film i did not let them have an impact on my viewing of it first i think we all have to remember that this movie is coming from james cameron the man who brought us the terminator aliens the abyss produced point break and wrote strange days terminator 2 judgment day true lies and tvs dark angel this movie made james cameron probably one of the most successful directors in hollywood even before james cameron had never ever really experienced that much success with any of his previous filmssecond look at this film for what is which is a fictional love story in a historical setting not a historical romance third this is the most expensive movie hollywood has ever made costing 200 million to make director james cameron risked his entire career as well as sinking paramount studios into bankruptcy it was a very very big gamble that fortunately for james cameron and paramount studios would pay offfourth im a guy i dont care to see leonardo dicaprio and i didnt watch this movie just to see kate winslet strip either but i watched because im a fan of james cameron and i have been since the terminator fifth i know that this is one of those movies that when there is a wide range of comments about it that it is best view it for yourself and then make your own judgment that being said ive watched at least ten times since 1998 and i still dont know whether or not i hate it or like it but i give an eight out of ten based squarely on my own viewings and not popular opinion

i was skeptical when i first went to see the movie with my wife i had heard it was a chickflick and that the director had incorporated fictional characters into the real life drama i was pleasantly surprised when i left the theatre the movie delivered a compelling and factual account of the disaster intertwined with the fictional main characters jack and rose were important to the movie they really told the story of so many of the actual victims who remain unknown to this dayclose to 1500 souls went down with the ship the movie helped me to see their struggle to survive and what were the shocking effects of hitting the iceberg the tragedy at the world trade center certainly correlates with the disaster for modern times this movie has piqued my interest so much that i viewed the exhibit when it came to cleveland in 2002
